sub_title: Polyglot | Linguist | Translator | Teacher | Copy Editor | Consumer Behaviour Enthusiast | Chinese Market Expert |
summary:
I'm from Italy's fashion capital but consider myself a citizen of the world. 

Global marketer with an international and multidisciplinary academic background - Languages and International Relations BA (Italy), Chinese Studies and Chinese Language Teaching MAs (UK and China), International Marketing Management MSc (UK).

Curious about the world and consumer behaviour across cultures. I’m fluent in 4 languages - English, Italian, Mandarin Chinese and French. My passion for languages pushed me to explore the world beyond my comfort zone from a very young age and helped me develop an international mindset and a keen interest in understanding different cultures to boost cross-cultural communication.

I’m very determined, proactive and hardworking. I won scholarships in all the countries I’ve studied in - Italy: Catholic University of Milan academic merit scholarship 2014, China: Confucius Institute scholarship 2015 & 2016, UK: Leeds University Business School 2018 Dean’s UK/EU Excellence Scholarship

awards:
[{'title': "Dean's UK/EU Excellence Scholarship for MSc International Marketing Management", 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Leeds University Business School', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, {'title': 'Chinese Language Teaching Idols - 50 Finalists 汉教英雄会 - 进50强证书', 'description': 'The Chinese Language Teaching Idols is a China-based Chinese language teaching competition in which all Chinese universities offering the MTCSOL major (Master of Teaching Chinese to Speakers of Other Languages, 汉语国际教育专业硕士) get involved every year by signing up their best Chinese and foreign students majoring in Chinese teaching. The competition started in December 2016 and was divided into three rounds testing the candidates Chinese teaching skills as well as their knowledge and engagement with Chinese culture. I represented Nankai University until the final in June 2017 and ranked 14th out of 700 candidates.

https://www.ed.ac.uk/literatures-languages-cultures/asian-studies/student-prizes-and-awards 

http://news.nankai.edu.cn/zhxw/system/2017/04/17/000328334.shtml  ', 'issuer': 'Beijing Language and Culture University', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Confucius Institute Two-year Scholarship for academic merit', 'description': 'I was awarded the Confucius Institute Two-year Scholarship covering the tuition fees and living costs of the Chinese-taught Master of Teaching Chinese to Speakers of Other Languages at Tianjin Nankai University in June 2016.', 'issuer': 'Confucius Institute ', 'date': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': '孔子学院奖学金征文比赛  Fudan University Confucius Institute Scholarship Students Essay Writing Competition - Third prize ', 'description': 'At the end of the first semester at Fudan University Confucius Scholarship students were invited to take part in a Chinese Essay Writing Competition. The essay submissions had to be of at least 1000 characters and revolve on the topic 我的梦想与中国 (My dream with China). I wrote my essay on my experience of living and studying in China first in Beijing and then in Shanghai and was awarded third prize. 

http://www.cim.chinesecio.com/hbcms/f/article/info?id=addf5ba45006407fb0349a01ff60cb17 ', 'issuer': 'Fudan University Confucius Institute ', 'date': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, {'title': 'Confucius Institute One-semester Full Scholarship for academic merit ', 'description': 'Thanks to the recommendation of my professors at the University of Edinburgh I was awarded the Confucius Institute full scholarship covering the tuition fees and living costs of one semester at Shanghai Fudan University ', 'issuer': 'Confucius Institute and University of Edinburgh ', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, {'title': 'Borsa di studio per merito e reddito  Tuition Fee Waiver Scholarship based on academic merit and income', 'description': "At the end of my second year as an undergraduate student at the Catholic University of Milan I applied for   one of the 65 bursaries offered by the Catholic University itself. Academic merit and students' income were equally important eligibility criteria since the scholarship was a full tuition fee waiver. I was awarded the scholarship in February 2014 and ranked 11th out of 65 eligible candidates. ", 'issuer': 'Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore di Milano ', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}]
